headline: Afcon 2025: Every Premier League player going, fixtures and how to watch
body: Manchester United have lost three players while Sunderland have six at tournament in Morocco. Plus, dates, fixtures and how to watch
content:
Bazoumana Touré scored in stoppage time as defending champions Ivory Coast recovered from a two-goal deficit to beat Gabon 3-2 on Wednesday in the Africa Cup of Nations, which now enters the knockout stage.
Christopher Opéri crossed for Touré to head in the winner as Les Éléphants staged a dramatic comeback to finish top of Group F, just ahead of Cameroon, by virtue of scoring a goal more than the Indomitable Lions.
Opéri had also set up fellow substitute Evann Guessand for the equaliser in the 84th minute.
Five-time winners Cameroon also came from behind to beat Mozambique 2-1 in the other group game.
Both Ivory Coast and Cameroon finished with seven points each, with a goal difference of plus two, but Ivory Coast scored five goals, compared to Cameroon’s four.
Mozambique also progressed to the last 16 as one of the four best third-place finishers.
Gabon was already eliminated after starting with two defeats.

How can you watch matches at the Africa Cup of Nations?
All matches are being broadcast in the UK on either Channel 4, 4seven, All 4 or Channel 4 Sport YouTube.
Which Premier League players are at Afcon?
Arguably the biggest name in African football, Mohamed Salah has linked up with the Egypt squad after a turbulent few weeks with Liverpool. No other players have left Anfield for the tournament, giving the club a look at what life after Salah may be like.
Manchester City’s Omar Marmoush joins him with Egypt, having struggled for minutes after a knee injury in September. City will hope that Afcon can turn last season’s flashes of brilliance into consistent performances.
Some fanbases will be relieved not to lose key players. Newcastle United supporters will hope Yoane Wissa can kickstart his career on Tyneside after he was left out of DR Congo’s squad.
Antoine Semenyo’s Ghana did not qualify, allowing Bournemouth to keep hold of their top scorer but also clearing the way for immediate transfer business as the window opens. He will be in action against England at the World Cup.

headline: The Ashes 2025-26: When is the next Test, start times and how to watch England vs Australia
body: England are 3-1 down after the quick resolution of the Melbourne Test, with series moving on to its finale in Sydney
content:
England’s hopes of winning the Ashes were over after defeat in Adelaide but they have at least avoided a whitewash by winning the fourth Test in Melbourne.
However, Gus Atkinson has been has become the third member of England’s fast bowling battery to be ruled out of the Ashes tour.
Atkinson suffered a hamstring injury on the second day of the Boxing Day Test. He underwent a scan on Sunday and the end of his tour has now been confirmed.
This means Matthew Potts is likely to come into England’s attack in Sydney, with Surrey’s Matthew Fisher the only other possibility. They have opted not to call up another bowler, meaning their squad is now just 14 strong.
Skip to:
- When are the Ashes? 2025 series dates
- Test match start times
- How to watch on TV and streaming
- Who is commentating on the coverage?
- What are the odds?

headline: Gruyère and spinach French toast with bacon and tomato relish
body: A delicious combination starring homemade relish
content:
Top with fried mushrooms, instead of the bacon, if you’re vegetarian.
Overview
25 mins
40 mins
4
Ingredients
For the tomato relish
- ½ tbsp olive oil
- 1 small onion, finely sliced
- 1 garlic clove, finely chopped
- 1 red chilli, halved, deseeded and finely chopped
- ¼ tsp smoked paprika
- 450g tomatoes, chopped
- 75ml red-wine vinegar, or as needed
- 50g soft light-brown sugar, or as needed
For the French toast
- 350g spinach, washed and any thick stems removed
- 35g butter
- 8 slices white sliced bread
- 230g gruyère or comté, sliced very thinly
- 7 large eggs, lightly beaten
- 3 tbsp milk
- Groundnut oil, for frying
- 8-12 rashers streaky bacon
Method
Make the relish first. Heat ½ tbsp oil in a saucepan and cook 1 finely sliced small onion until soft.
Add 1 finely chopped garlic clove, 1 finely chopped red chilli and ¼ tsp smoked paprika, and cook for 2 minutes.
Tip in 450g chopped fresh tomatoes, 75ml red-wine vinegar and 50g soft light-brown sugar, and bring to the boil.
Turn the heat down and simmer for about 20 minutes. The mixture should be thick and a little jammy. Season and taste – you might want to adjust the sweet-sour balance by adding some more vinegar or more sugar. Leave to cool.
Preheat the oven to 160C/150C fan/gas mark 3.
Put 350g spinach in a saucepan and add 2 tbsp water. Cover and set over a low to medium heat, turning the spinach a couple of times as it cooks. Within 4-5 minutes it will have wilted to softness.
Drain. Once it’s cool enough to handle, press out the excess water, then chop roughly.
Melt about 10g of the butter in a frying pan and sauté the spinach. Season. It should be buttery but not wet. Leave to cool.
Make four sandwiches using the 8 slices of white bread and some of the butter (the rest is for frying the sandwiches in). On each base piece of bread divide half the sliced gruyère or comté, then the spinach and then the other half of the cheese. Put the second piece of buttered bread on top. Cut each sandwich in half.
Beat the 7 large eggs with 3 tbsp milk in a broad, shallow dish (you may find it easier to use two dishes). Season.
Dip the sandwiches in the egg mixture, leave them to soak for a little while, then turn them over. You want to soak them until they have absorbed a lot of the egg, but not so long that they have become soft and are beginning to fall apart.
Heat the rest of the butter with about 1 tbsp oil across two large frying pans.
Over a medium heat, fry the sandwiches, flipping them over every so often, until you can see the egg batter has cooked and the cheese has melted. You need to press down with a spatula on the sandwiches so that the cheese inside gets close to the heat of the base of the pan. The sandwiches should turn lovely and golden.
Transfer them to a dish lined with kitchen paper and keep them warm in a low oven while you fry 8-12 rashers streaky bacon in the same pan.
Serve the French toast with crispy bacon on top and a dollop of the tomato relish.

headline: Ruben Amorim’s Man Utd produce painful watch to end year feebly
body: Ruben Amorim’s Man Utd produce painful watch to end year feebly
content:
A year that began with Ruben Amorim anointing his Manchester United side as “maybe the worst” in the club’s 147-year history ended with a performance that reaffirmed just how much ground this team still has to make up.
United were missing many of their best players, from captain Bruno Fernandes and top scorer Bryan Mbeumo to Mason Mount and Amad Diallo, but that did not excuse such a feeble, impoverished display. There was no conviction, no energy, no quality, just a familiar listlessness that was painful to watch.
For Wolves, who possessed the game’s best player in the dynamic, youthful figure of Mateus Mane, this was one of their brightest showings in a torrid season.
They are still without a win at the halfway stage but this result ended a run of 11 successive Premier League defeats and will offer manager Rob Edwards some crumbs of comfort heading into the new year.
They ran further than United, had more touches in their opponent’s penalty area than the home side and a higher xG. But for the United goalkeeper Senne Lammens, comfortably his team’s stand-out performer, they might even have taken the three points.
Amorim veered between the agitated and the angry on the touchline throughout the game and had to listen to fans booing not just the half-time and full-time whistles but also his own substitutions.
